FuncDef:
The set tpm password command sets a password for the trusted platform module (TPM).
The default password of tpm is random value.
Examples: Please configure the authentication password first.
Info: Successfully set the TPM password of the board in slot 17.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To improve security, run the set tpm password command to change the TPM password.If the device needs to be rolled back to a version that does not support the configuration of the TPM password, run the set tpm password command to restore the preset TPM password before the rollback.
Implementation Procedure
When you run the set tpm password command to set a new password, you are prompted to input the original password first. After you input the correct original password, the system prompts you to input the new password twice. The new command can be set only when the two new passwords that you input are the same.
Precautions
The new password set using the set tpm password command contains 8 to 32 characters and must contain at least two types of the following characters: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits, and special characters.
If the device needs to be rolled back to a version that does not support the configuration of the TPM password, run the set tpm password command to restore the preset TPM password to Changeme_123 before the rollback. Otherwise, the RA function may be unavailable.
